mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tyler, Robert, 1816-1877
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Tyler is impressed by his efforts and advises him to keep up with "painstaking energy" on the improvement of his handwriting; advises Robert to listen to his mother; advises him to develop self-control and perseverance; hopes he will be compensated for his suffering by "obtaining both fame and money"; he reports that all the children are well; fears that he will die soon and is worried that he will leave debts. Autograph Letter Signed.
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1875 February 25, Robert Tyler, Montgomery, Alabama to son
